intro: Petrophile triternata, commonly known as the three-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Petrophile triternata is a hardy, low-growing shrub that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions.
